vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/150c914b-0179-4f31-b111-1b1b6e1f4b15">WORK-TO-RULE</keyword>         <topcClas>Industrial relations - Employment and labour</topcClas>         <topcClas>Management and organisation - Industry and management</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The Workplace Industrial Relations Survey (WIRS) series was designed to contribute to a better understanding of the processes which underlie employment relationships by making available for the first time large, systematic and dispassionate evidence about a broad range of industrial relations and employment practices across almost every sector of the economy.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> The main areas covered in the data include: basic establishment data for industrial relations; union organisation; bargaining structure; procedures; payment methods; industrial action; the introduction of technical and organisational change and a variety of other factors.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate>1980 and 1984</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>No information recorded</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Institutions/organisations</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Employees</universe>         <universe>Establishments</universe>         <universe>Managers</universe>         <universe>Trade union officers</universe>         <universe>All working establishments in England, Scotland and Wales, listed in the 1977 Census of Employment and stated to have employed 25 or more employees at the time of the census and which had survived until 1984 with 25 or more employees.</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Longitudinal/panel/cohort</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Social and Community
